name: DIE WELT
notes:
Background and Format:
Die Welt is a German national daily newspaper published by the Axel Springer AG company. It was founded in Hamburg in 1946 by the British occupying forces, aiming to provide a "quality newspaper" modelled on The Times. It originally carried news and British-viewpoint editorial content, but from 1947 it adopted a policy of providing two leading articles on major questions, one British and one German. At its peak in the occupation period, it had a circulation of around a million. The modern paper takes a self-described "liberal cosmopolitan" position in editing, but Die Welt is generally considered to be conservative. The newspaper currently publishes a compact edition entitled Welt Kompakt, a 32-page cut-down version of the main broadsheet. Welt Kompakt has a fresher look and is targeted to a younger public.
Audience and Readership:
Readers of WELT are 58% male and 66% are the main wage earners in their household. 36% of readers have a university or college degree.
Frequency:
The paper is published on a daily basis but does not appear on Sundays, but the linked publication Welt am Sonntag takes its place.
Circulation:
DIE WELT sells an average of 201,159 copies.
Ad Rates:
Ad rates can be viewed here.
Distribution:
DIE WELT is available in all German-speaking regions and at select news agents globally (in 130 countries).

Hintergrund und Format:
DIE WELT ist eine deutsche überregionale Tageszeitung der Axel Springer AG. Von den Siegermächten des Zweiten Weltkriegs in der Britischen Besatzungszone in Hamburg gegründet, erschien sie erstmals am 2. April 1946 und wurde 1953 von Axel Springer übernommen. Das Blatt wird dem bürgerlich-konservativen Spektrum zugerechnet. Wirtschaftspolitisch ist sie deutlich wirtschaftsliberal eingestellt. Die Welt beinhaltet tägliche Regionalausgaben in Berlin und Hamburg, 1997 bis 2002 auch in Bremen und 2002 kurzzeitig in Bayern. Die Zentralredaktion von Welt und Welt am Sonntag befindet sich in Berlin. Hier wird ebenfalls die Berliner Morgenpost erstellt. Ab 2002 wurde die Zusammenlegung der drei Redaktionen umgesetzt. Die Welt wird in 130 Ländern verkauft und erscheint im Nordischen Format.
Zielgruppe und Leserschaft:
WELT-Leser sind zu 58% männlich und zu 66% Hauptverdiener im Haushalt. 39% der Leser haben ein abgeschlossenes Studium.
Erscheinungsweise:
DIE WELT erscheint täglich außer sonntags. Am Sonntag erscheint die Sonntagsausgabe WELT am Sonntag (Wams).
Auflage:
DIE WELT hat eine verkaufte Auflage von 201.159 Stück.
Anzeigenpreise:
Anzeigenpreise sind hier einsehbar.
Verbreitungsgebiet:
DIE WELT ist im gesamten deutschsprachigen Raum und bei ausgewählten Kiosken weltweit (in 130 Ländern) erhältlich.

Gorkana EU Newsletter Alert: Thursday 3 September 2015
Stefan Aust has been appointed as Editor-in-Chief Ad Interim for the German media group WELTN24, which includes the German daily national newspaper DIE WELT and the German news broadcaster N24, effective 1st January 2016. Stefan, who is currently the group’s Publisher, will replace Jan-Eric Peters, who has been appointed as Chief Product Officer and Deputy CEO for the news app UPDAY.

DIE WELT’s editorial team can be reached at chefredaktion@welt.de
DIE WELT’s website can be viewed here
N24’s website can be viewed here

Gorkana EU DACH Alert: Thursday 3 September 2015
Stefan Aust wird zum 1. Januar 2016 kommisarischer Chefredakteur der deutschen WELTN24-Gruppe, zu der die überregionale Tageszeitung DIE WELT und der Nachrichtensender N24 gehören. Aust, bislang als Herausgeber der WELTN24 Gruppe tätig, löst damit Jan-Eric Peters ab, der den Posten des Chief Product Officer und stellvertretenden CEO von UPDAY, einer Nachrichten-App, übernehmen wird.

Die Redaktion von DIE WELT können Sie unter chefredaktion@welt.de erreichen. 
Die Webseite von DIE WELT finden Sie hier.
Die Webseite von N24 finden Sie hier.

Gorkana Alert: Thursday 9 July 2015
The German publishing group WELT-Gruppe and the German news broadcaster N24 are proceeding with their integration process. All online, print and TV editorial content of the daily national newspaper DIE WELT and N24 will include the word ‘WELT’ in their names e.g. N24 WELT. As a part of the integration process the companies’ logos will be rebranded and the digital offerings of both WELT and N24 will be given a new appearance.

For further information, PR Officer Bianca-Maria Dardon Mota can be reached at bianca.dardon@axelspringer.de
N24’s website can be viewed at www.n24.de
DIE WELT’s website can be viewed at www.welt.de

Gorkana Alert: Thursday 9 July 2015
Die deutsche Verlagsgruppe WELT-Gruppe und der deutsche Sender für Nachrichten N24 setzen ihren Integrationsprozess fort. Alle journalistischen Angebote der deutschen überregionalen Zeitung DIE WELT und von N24 im Web, in Print und im TV tragen in Zukunft ,WELT’ im Namen. Das heißt: Künftig wird auch N24 WELT heißen. Im Rahmen der Integration ist noch die Annäherung der Erscheinungsbilder von N24 und allen derzeitigen Angeboten der WELT zu machen. Ein neuer digitaler Auftritt für die bisherigen digitalen Produkte der WELT und von N24 wird auch enstehen.

Für weitere Informationen können Sie Pressesprecherin Bianca-Maria Dardon Mota unter bianca.dardon@axelspringer.de erreichen.
Die Webseite von N24 finden Sie hier.
Die Webseite von DIE WELT finden Sie hier.

Gorkana Alert: Thursday 18 June 2015
Oliver Polak, a German stand-up comedian, has been appointed as a Columnist for the German daily national newspaper DIE WELT, effective 21st June. His column is called ‘Supersad’ and reports about the 'catastrophe of being' (Katastrophe des Daseins) with dark humour. It will be published in the newspaper’s print and digital editions as well as the website's video section.

For further information, Press Officer Svenja Friedrich can be reached on +49 (0)30 2591 11609 and svenja.friedrich@axelspringer.de
DIE WELT’s editorial team can be reached at chefredaktion@welt.de

Gorkana Alert: Thursday 12 March 2015
Corresponding with the release of the Apple Watch, the German publisher Axel Springer will launch a news app for the daily nationals BILD and DIE WELT as well as the broadcaster N24. The app will allow Apple Watch users to access information and news in a shortened version on the watch's display. Users who wish to receive more information with regard to certain topics can create a reminder list and access the full story via the iPhone or iPad app.
For further information, Press Officer Svenja Friedrich can be reached on +49 30 2591 77609 and svenja.friedrich@axelspringer.de

Gorkana Alert: Wednesday 11 March 2015
The seven European daily newspapers DIE WELT, El País, La Repubblica, Le Figaro, Le Soir, Tages-Anzeiger and Tribune de Genève have formed the Leading European Newspaper Alliance (LENA). Javier Moreno, former Editor-in-Chief for El País will be the first Director of the Alliance. Emphasis will be put on the development and interexchange of editorial content. Each member will provide selected articles, which can be used by the other members according to demand. Moreover, certain interviews and features will be commissioned especially for simultaneous publication in all newspapers. A staff exchange programme will allow journalists to get to know the workflow in other newspapers and provide them with the opportunity to extend their skill set.
For further information, Press Officer Svenja Friedrich can be reached on +49 (0)30 2591 77609 and svenja.friedrich@axelspringer.de

Gorkana Alert: Thursday 18 December 2014
The German daily newspaper DIE WELT will launch a new art supplement in the first half of 2015. The supplement, entitled BLAU, will cover a wide spectrum of artistic topics, ranging from the ancient world and established artists to contemporary performance and video arts. BLAU will be published on a monthly basis with the editor being Cornelius Tittel.

For further information, PR Officer Svenja Friedrich can be reached on +49 (0)30 2591 77609 and svenja.friedrich@axelspringer.de
DIE WELT’s editorial team can be reached on +49 (0)30 2591 0 and redaktion@welt.de

Gorkana Alert: Wednesday 12 February 2014
The German daily national DIE WELT is changing its price and will be available for €2.20 from 17th February onwards.
DIE WELT’s editorial team can be reached on +49 (0)30 2591 0 and redaktion@welt.de

Gorkana Alert: Tuesday 10 December 2013
The German publisher Axel Springer SE is acquiring 100 per cent of the N24 Media GmbH. Axel Springer SE is planning to combine the German TV broadcaster N24 and its media brand WELT-Group. The editorial team of the WELT-Group will be extended to include the N24 digital editorial team. The new joint editorial team will in future produce both brands' journalistic content for all the digital channels, as well as for the WELT-Group's print products. In addition to this, N24’s TV and programme editorial team, will produce all the TV formats and moving images for the digital offers.
For further information Axel Springer SE’s Press Officer Tobias Fröhlich can be reached on +49 (0)30 2591 776 20 and tobias.froehlich@axelspringer.de

Gorkana Alert: Tuesday 13 August 2013
The German WELT-Group, whose flagship title is the daily newspaper DIE WELT, will open its new bureau in Sydney, Australia. The goal is to keep the publication’s readers up-to-date day and night. The new office, planned to be opened on 2nd September 2013, will be staffed with two reporters.
For further information, please contact DIE WELT's editorial office at chefredakteur@welt.de

Gorkana European Alert: Wednesday 31th March 2010
The German nationals DIE WELT, WELT KOMPAKT and the Sunday edition WELT am SONNTAG will be available as a monthly digital subscription on the Apple "Kiosk-App" (newsagent application), effective 3rd April. Users will have the possibility to read the publication’s current news on the iPad, specially formatted to provide easy navigation and legibility. The subscription will cost € 7.99.
For more information, please contact Press Officer Christian Garrels on +49 (0)30 2591 77651 and christian.garrels@axelspringer.de

Gorkana European Alert: Monday 20th August 2007
At the end of September Axel Springer AG will launch a new quarterly healthcare supplement, Tithon, to be distributed alongside Die Welt, Welt am Sonntag and Berliner Morgenpost. The magazine, which will have an initial print run of over 1 million, will be edited by a specialised external agency. For more information contact Kerstin Kühl who can be reached on +49 (0)30 25 91 73040 and kerstin.kuehl@axelspringer.de

Gorkana European Alert: Wednesday 2nd May 2007
Welt Online has recently launched its new web offering Welt Debatte www.debatte.welt.de. The interactive website holds reporter commentary from journalists at Die Welt, Welt Online, Welt am Sonntag, and current news stories on a range of topics from politics, business and science to sport, society and culture. Users are then invited to comment on and query these news stories. For more information contact Dr. Dirk Meyer-Bosse (Press Office) on +49 (0)30 259 177 641 and dirk.meyer-bosse@axelspringer.de.
